name: WEST YORKSHIRE COMBINED AUTHORITY
goal:
West Yorkshire Combined Authority (WYCA) brings together Bradford, Calderdale, Kirklees, Leeds, Wakefield and York councils / municipalities and the Leeds City Region Enterprise Partnership (LEP) as a united force for economic growth.

WYCA works with private and public sector partners to raise the quality of life in our region through business growth, job creation, a trained and skilled workforce and the building of new and affordable homes, underpinned by a modern, integrated transport network
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Climate Action, Competition, Culture, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Information Society, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Main business to lead on the European Structural and Investment Fund Strategy for the Leeds City Region.

Main funds including European Social Fund, European Regional Development Fund and the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development.

Involvement in other key funds including Interreg - with a focus on Transport related initiatives.

Other key funds followed include Horizon 2020, Elena focusing on the development of new energy based initiatives.

All other structural and non-structural funds are also of interest.

Key policy areas followed ;
* EU regional policy
* Urban agenda - Euro Cities and the Urban Development Network
* Research and Innovation policies
* EU industrial policy
* Environment policy
* Transport policy
* Smart Specialisation
* Education and employment
